tooltip.worldoffoods.tomato.tooltip: Red and juicy, good for both eating and throwing.
tooltip.worldoffoods.eggplant.tooltip: A mysterious purple vegetable, becomes delicious when cooked with fire.
tooltip.worldoffoods.broccoli.tooltip: This tiny, tree-like vegetable is more nutritious than you think.
tooltip.worldoffoods.artichoke.tooltip: Hides a delicious heart beneath its thorny exterior.
tooltip.worldoffoods.asparagus.tooltip: This spear-like vegetable is a herald of spring.
tooltip.worldoffoods.blackberry.tooltip: A dark and sweet treasure behind thorny bushes.
tooltip.worldoffoods.leek.tooltip: A gentler, taller relative of the onion.
tooltip.worldoffoods.blueberry.tooltip: Tiny bursts of flavor the color of the sky.
tooltip.worldoffoods.cranberry.tooltip: The bog's sour gem, a staple of winter feasts.
tooltip.worldoffoods.currant.tooltip: Bright, tart, and refreshing little orbs.
tooltip.worldoffoods.elderberry.tooltip: Dark purple clusters carry a whisper for mysterious potions.
tooltip.worldoffoods.grape.tooltip: Grows in bunches, its juice is highly valued.
tooltip.worldoffoods.pineapple.tooltip: Armored on the outside, sweeter than honey on the inside.
tooltip.worldoffoods.raspberry.tooltip: Delicate and sweet, you can wear it like a ring on your finger.
tooltip.worldoffoods.strawberry.tooltip: A sweet, red jewel kissed by the sun.
tooltip.worldoffoods.cabbage.tooltip: A tight ball of layered leaves.
tooltip.worldoffoods.bellpepper.tooltip: Comes in many colors, a sweet pepper with no heat.
tooltip.worldoffoods.cauliflower.tooltip: This cloud-like vegetable is actually a flower.
tooltip.worldoffoods.celery.tooltip: Watery and fibrous, makes a crunch when you chew.
tooltip.worldoffoods.blackbean.tooltip: Dark and nutritious, a must-have for stews.
tooltip.worldoffoods.cucumber.tooltip: Cooling and watery, as green as a Creeper.
tooltip.worldoffoods.kale.tooltip: Its tough leaves can withstand even the harshest winters.
tooltip.worldoffoods.garlic.tooltip: Its pungent smell might keep monsters away... worth a try.
tooltip.worldoffoods.hops.tooltip: A bittering aroma that makes certain beverages more interesting.
tooltip.worldoffoods.chile_pepper.toolti: A fiery bite! Some like it hot.
tooltip.worldoffoods.squash.tooltip: Comes in all shapes and sizes, the star of sweet or savory recipes.
tooltip.worldoffoods.lettuce.tooltip: A rabbit's favorite, essential for sandwiches.
tooltip.worldoffoods.onion.tooltip: Might make you cry when you chop it, but adds flavor to every dish.
tooltip.worldoffoods.radish.tooltip: Spicy and crisp, it pops out of the ground quickly.
tooltip.worldoffoods.rhubarb.tooltip: The stalks are sour, the leaves are poison. Be careful!
tooltip.worldoffoods.rutabaga.tooltip: The hardy and filling root of cold climates.
tooltip.worldoffoods.soybean.tooltip: Incredibly versatile, can even be turned into tofu.
tooltip.worldoffoods.spinach.tooltip: This leafy green might give you iron-like strength... maybe.
tooltip.worldoffoods.sweetpotato.tooltip: A sweeter, orange cousin to the regular potato.
tooltip.worldoffoods.greenonion.tooltip: A fresher, milder version of the onion's sharpness.
tooltip.worldoffoods.tomatillo.tooltip: A tart flavor hidden behind a green husk.
tooltip.worldoffoods.turnip.tooltip: A humble but hearty root hidden beneath the soil.
tooltip.worldoffoods.yam.tooltip: Orange and starchy, works wonders in a furnace.
tooltip.worldoffoods.zucchini.tooltip: Grows fast! If you're not careful, it might take over your farm.
tooltip.worldoffoods.barley.tooltip: A hardy grain, perfect for bread and hearty soups.
tooltip.worldoffoods.basil.tooltip: Its fragrant leaves add a fresh aroma to meals.
tooltip.worldoffoods.ginger.tooltip: A sharp and spicy root that both warms and invigorates.
tooltip.worldoffoods.mustard.tooltip: A powerful, sharp flavor emerges from its tiny seeds.
tooltip.worldoffoods.oat.tooltip: The secret to a horse's strength. Also makes decent cookies.
tooltip.worldoffoods.peanut.tooltip: A shelled surprise that grows underground.
tooltip.worldoffoods.pepper.tooltip: A common spice, good for any dish.
tooltip.worldoffoods.rice.tooltip: Tiny grains that grow in waterlogged fields, feeding worlds.
tooltip.worldoffoods.turmeric.tooltip: A root that stains gold with an earthy spice.
tooltip.worldoffoods.vanilla.tooltip: The sweet, fragrant pods of a tropical vine.
